predicate.note: Frames file for 'scrounge' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus.

roleset.name: to obtain by begging or borrowing with no intention of reparation

example.name: transitive
example.text: And some grain analysts are predicting that corn prices might gyrate this month as exporters scrounge [*-1] to find enough of the crop [0] [*T*-2] to meet their obligations to the Soviets .
example.arg: [*-1] to find enough of the crop [0] [*T*-2] to meet their obligations to the Soviets

example.name: prepositional Arg1
example.text: The man who [*T*-1] wore out his shoes [*-3] wandering around Guadalajara in 1958 [*PPA*-4] , [*-3] describing in his travel book `` Viaje a la Alcarria '' how he scrounged for food and stayed in squalid inns [*T*-2] , now tours Spain in a Rolls-Royce .
